org.apache.juneau.rest

Class RequestHeaders

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractMap<K,V>
      • java.util.TreeMap<String,String[]>
        • org.apache.juneau.rest.RequestHeaders
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable, Map<String,String[]>, NavigableMap<String,String[]>, SortedMap<String,String[]>

    public class RequestHeaders
extends TreeMap<String,String[]>
    Represents the headers in an HTTP request.

    Entries are stored in a case-insensitive map.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.util.AbstractMap

        AbstractMap.SimpleEntry<K,V>, AbstractMap.SimpleImmutableEntry<K,V>

    • Method Detail

      • addDefault

        public RequestHeaders addDefault(Map<String,String> defaultEntries)
        Adds default entries to these headers.

        This includes the default headers defined on the servlet and method levels.

        Parameters:
        defaultEntries - The default entries. Can be null.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).

      • put

        public RequestHeaders put(String name,
                          Enumeration<String> values)
        Adds a set of header values to this object.
        Parameters:
        name - The header name.
        values - The header values.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).

      • getFirst

        public String getFirst(String name)
        Returns the specified header value, or null if the header doesn't exist.

        If allowHeaderParams init parameter is true, then first looks for &HeaderName=x in the URL query string.

        Parameters:
        name - The header name.
        Returns:
        The header value, or null if it doesn't exist.

      • getFirst

        public String getFirst(String name,
                       String def)
        Returns the specified header value, or a default value if the header doesn't exist.

        If allowHeaderParams init parameter is true, then first looks for &HeaderName=x in the URL query string.

        Parameters:
        name - The HTTP header name.
        def - The default value to return if the header value isn't found.
        Returns:
        The header value, or the default value if the header isn't present.

      • put

        public void put(String name,
                Object value)
        Sets a request header value.
        Parameters:
        name - The header name.
        value - The header value.

      • get

        public <T> T get(String name,
                 Class<T> type)
        Returns the specified header value converted to a POJO.

        The type can be any POJO type convertable from a String (See POJOs Convertable From Strings).

        Examples:

        // Parse into an integer. int myheader = req.getHeader("My-Header", int.class); // Parse a UUID. UUID myheader = req.getHeader("My-Header", UUID.class);

        Type Parameters:
        T - The class type to convert the header value to.
        Parameters:
        name - The HTTP header name.
        type - The class type to convert the header value to.
        Returns:
        The parameter value converted to the specified class type.

      • get

        public <T> T get(String name,
                 T def,
                 Class<T> type)
        Same as get(String, Class) but returns a default value if not found.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The class type to convert the header value to.
        Parameters:
        name - The HTTP header name.
        def - The default value if the header was not specified or is null.
        type - The class type to convert the header value to.
        Returns:
        The parameter value converted to the specified class type.

      • get

        public <T> T get(String name,
                 Type type,
                 Type... args)
          throws ParseException
        Returns the specified header value converted to a POJO.

        The type can be any POJO type convertable from a String (See POJOs Convertable From Strings).

        Examples:

        // Parse into a linked-list of strings. List<String> myheader = req.getHeader("My-Header", LinkedList.class, String.class);

        Type Parameters:
        T - The class type to convert the header value to.
        Parameters:
        name - The HTTP header name.
        type - The type of object to create.
        Can be any of the following: ClassMeta, Class, ParameterizedType, GenericArrayType
        args - The type arguments of the class if it's a collection or map.
        Can be any of the following: ClassMeta, Class, ParameterizedType, GenericArrayType
        Ignored if the main type is not a map or collection.
        Returns:
        The parameter value converted to the specified class type.
        Throws:
        ParseException - If the header could not be converted to the specified type.

      • getAccept

        public Accept getAccept()
        Returns the Accept header on the request.

        Content-Types that are acceptable for the response.

        Example:

        Accept: text/plain

        Returns:
        The parsed Accept header on the request, or null if not found.

      • getAcceptCharset

        public AcceptCharset getAcceptCharset()
        Returns the Accept-Charset header on the request.

        Character sets that are acceptable.

        Example:

        Accept-Charset: utf-8

        Returns:
        The parsed Accept-Charset header on the request, or null if not found.

      • getAcceptEncoding

        public AcceptEncoding getAcceptEncoding()
        Returns the Accept-Encoding header on the request.

        List of acceptable encodings.

        Example:

        Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate

        Returns:
        The parsed Accept-Encoding header on the request, or null if not found.

      • getAcceptLanguage

        public AcceptLanguage getAcceptLanguage()
        Returns the Accept-Language header on the request.

        List of acceptable human languages for response.

        Example:

        Accept-Language: en-US

        Returns:
        The parsed Accept-Language header on the request, or null if not found.

      • getAuthorization

        public Authorization getAuthorization()
        Returns the Authorization header on the request.

        Authentication credentials for HTTP authentication.

        Example:

        Authorization: Basic QWxhZGRpbjpvcGVuIHNlc2FtZQ==

        Returns:
        The parsed Authorization header on the request, or null if not found.

      • getCacheControl

        public CacheControl getCacheControl()
        Returns the Cache-Control header on the request.

        Used to specify directives that must be obeyed by all caching mechanisms along the request-response chain.

        Example:

        Cache-Control: no-cache

        Returns:
        The parsed Cache-Control header on the request, or null if not found.

      • getConnection

        public Connection getConnection()
        Returns the Connection header on the request.

        Control options for the current connection and list of hop-by-hop request fields.

        Example:

        Connection: keep-alive Connection: Upgrade

        Returns:
        The parsed header on the request, or null if not found.

      • getContentLength

        public ContentLength getContentLength()
        Returns the Content-Length header on the request.

        The length of the request body in octets (8-bit bytes).

        Example:

        Content-Length: 348

        Returns:
        The parsed Content-Length header on the request, or null if not found.

      • getContentType

        public ContentType getContentType()
        Returns the Content-Type header on the request.

        The MIME type of the body of the request (used with POST and PUT requests).

        Example:

        Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded

        Returns:
        The parsed Content-Type header on the request, or null if not found.

      • getDate

        public Date getDate()
        Returns the Date header on the request.

        The date and time that the message was originated (in "HTTP-date" format as defined by RFC 7231 Date/Time Formats).

        Example:

        Date: Tue, 15 Nov 1994 08:12:31 GMT

        Returns:
        The parsed Date header on the request, or null if not found.

      • getExpect

        public Expect getExpect()
        Returns the Expect header on the request.

        Indicates that particular server behaviors are required by the client.

        Example:

        Expect: 100-continue

        Returns:
        The parsed Expect header on the request, or null if not found.

      • getFrom

        public From getFrom()
        Returns the From header on the request.

        The email address of the user making the request.

        Example:

        From: user@example.com

        Returns:
        The parsed From header on the request, or null if not found.

      • getHost

        public Host getHost()
        Returns the Host header on the request.

        The domain name of the server (for virtual hosting), and the TCP port number on which the server is listening. The port number may be omitted if the port is the standard port for the service requested.

        Example:

        Host: en.wikipedia.org:8080 Host: en.wikipedia.org

        Returns:
        The parsed Host header on the request, or null if not found.

      • getIfMatch

        public IfMatch getIfMatch()
        Returns the If-Match header on the request.

        Only perform the action if the client supplied entity matches the same entity on the server. This is mainly for methods like PUT to only update a resource if it has not been modified since the user last updated it.

        Example:

        If-Match: "737060cd8c284d8af7ad3082f209582d"

        Returns:
        The parsed If-Match header on the request, or null if not found.

      • getIfModifiedSince

        public IfModifiedSince getIfModifiedSince()
        Returns the If-Modified-Since header on the request.

        Allows a 304 Not Modified to be returned if content is unchanged.

        Example:

        If-Modified-Since: Sat, 29 Oct 1994 19:43:31 GMT

        Returns:
        The parsed If-Modified-Since header on the request, or null if not found.

      • getIfNoneMatch

        public IfNoneMatch getIfNoneMatch()
        Returns the If-None-Match header on the request.

        Allows a 304 Not Modified to be returned if content is unchanged, see HTTP ETag.

        Example:

        If-None-Match: "737060cd8c284d8af7ad3082f209582d"

        Returns:
        The parsed If-None-Match header on the request, or null if not found.

      • getIfRange

        public IfRange getIfRange()
        Returns the If-Range header on the request.

        If the entity is unchanged, send me the part(s) that I am missing; otherwise, send me the entire new entity.

        Example:

        If-Range: "737060cd8c284d8af7ad3082f209582d"

        Returns:
        The parsed If-Range header on the request, or null if not found.

      • getIfUnmodifiedSince

        public IfUnmodifiedSince getIfUnmodifiedSince()
        Returns the If-Unmodified-Since header on the request.

        Only send the response if the entity has not been modified since a specific time.

        Example:

        If-Unmodified-Since: Sat, 29 Oct 1994 19:43:31 GMT

        Returns:
        The parsed If-Unmodified-Since header on the request, or null if not found.

      • getMaxForwards

        public MaxForwards getMaxForwards()
        Returns the Max-Forwards header on the request.

        Limit the number of times the message can be forwarded through proxies or gateways.

        Example:

        Max-Forwards: 10

        Returns:
        The parsed Max-Forwards header on the request, or null if not found.

      • getPragma

        public Pragma getPragma()
        Returns the Pragma header on the request.

        Implementation-specific fields that may have various effects anywhere along the request-response chain.

        Example:

        Pragma: no-cache

        Returns:
        The parsed Pragma header on the request, or null if not found.

      • getProxyAuthorization

        public ProxyAuthorization getProxyAuthorization()
        Returns the Proxy-Authorization header on the request.

        Authorization credentials for connecting to a proxy.

        Example:

        Proxy-Authorization: Basic QWxhZGRpbjpvcGVuIHNlc2FtZQ==

        Returns:
        The parsed Proxy-Authorization header on the request, or null if not found.

      • getRange

        public Range getRange()
        Returns the Range header on the request.

        Request only part of an entity. Bytes are numbered from 0.

        Example:

        Range: bytes=500-999

        Returns:
        The parsed Range header on the request, or null if not found.

      • getReferer

        public Referer getReferer()
        Returns the Referer header on the request.

        This is the address of the previous web page from which a link to the currently requested page was followed.

        Example:

        Referer: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page

        Returns:
        The parsed Referer header on the request, or null if not found.

      • getTE

        public TE getTE()
        Returns the TE header on the request.

        The transfer encodings the user agent is willing to accept: the same values as for the response header field Transfer-Encoding can be used, plus the "trailers" value (related to the "chunked" transfer method) to notify the server it expects to receive additional fields in the trailer after the last, zero-sized, chunk.

        Example:

        TE: trailers, deflate

        Returns:
        The parsed TE header on the request, or null if not found.

      • getTimeZone

        public TimeZone getTimeZone()
        Returns the Time-Zone header value on the request if there is one.

        Example: "GMT".

        Returns:
        The Time-Zone header value on the request, or null if not present.

      • getUserAgent

        public UserAgent getUserAgent()
        Returns the User-Agent header on the request.

        The user agent string of the user agent.

        Example:

        User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:12.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/21.0

        Returns:
        The parsed User-Agent header on the request, or null if not found.

      • getUpgrade

        public Upgrade getUpgrade()
        Returns the Upgrade header on the request.

        Ask the server to upgrade to another protocol.

        Example:

        Upgrade: HTTP/2.0, HTTPS/1.3, IRC/6.9, RTA/x11, websocket

        Returns:
        The parsed Upgrade header on the request, or null if not found.

      • getVia

        public Via getVia()
        Returns the Via header on the request.

        Informs the server of proxies through which the request was sent.

        Example:

        Via: 1.0 fred, 1.1 example.com (Apache/1.1)

        Returns:
        The parsed Via header on the request, or null if not found.

      • getWarning

        public Warning getWarning()
        Returns the Warning header on the request.

        A general warning about possible problems with the entity body.

        Example:

        Warning: 199 Miscellaneous warning

        Returns:
        The parsed Warning header on the request, or null if not found.
